result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Lewis Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2; STRAIGHT TIME
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 12/19/2014 @ 1:30pm, Br-23

miscConds.notes: AS TO ALL COUNTS: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

No contact with firearms. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

AS TO ALL COUNTS:
- A course in Anger Management.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by Agent.
- No contact with M.M., unless approved by this Court, Children's Court, or BMCW.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

timeConds.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT; STAYED pending review

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Lewis Carter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael Lewis Carter in court.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further is not needed.

Defendant Michael Lewis Carter in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Court reviewed and returned photographs and certificates. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 4 DAYS time served, straight time. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, straight time. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent, straight time. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 25 DAYS (as to each count) in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-A course in anger management.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with M.M., unless approved by this court, children's court, or BMCW. 
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Lewis Carter in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Irene Parthum for Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 23 is in trial, court adjourned Sentencing to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 & 3 of the Amended Information
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Michael Lewis Carter in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Cynthia M Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Received & Filed, Amended Information:
AS TO COUNT 1
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to three Counts: 
COUNT 1: Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.
COUNT 2: Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.
COUNT 3: Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Lewis Carter in court with attorney Elizabeth Anne Carlson.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing in branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Michael Lewis Carter in court with attorney Elizabeth Anne Carlson.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Lewis Carter in court without counsel.  Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Court held colloquy with defendant. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Attorney Elizabeth A Carlson, present in court via telephone, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $60.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month starting 05/01/2014 and then on the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing date in branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Copy of Letter from SPD to Defendant.

Defendant Michael Lewis Carter in court. Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant in court without counsel. Case passed to allow SPD Attorney Lisa Schlieben to I-form the defendant. Case recalled. Lisa Schlieben appeared as a friend of the court. Defendant is eligible and the SPD will appoint counsel. Case adjourned to branch 23 for adjourned Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MM (10/31/08), UNLESS AS APPROVED PER CHILDREN'S COURT ORDERS, OR IF CHILDREN'S COURT IS NOT INVOLVED, UNLESS AS APPROVED PER THE BUREAU OF MILWAUKEE CHILD WELFARE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael Lewis Carter in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Michael Lewis Carter in custody.  Michael C. Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
